comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Aimee Christine Rochester (1911-1959), daughter of Mr. Richmond Rochester Jr. and his wife, Aimee L. Gunning Rochester. Aimee Gunning's grandfather was Leland Stanford. Little Aimee became Aimee C. Muniz, and later Aimee McGregor. Her husband Austin Malcolm "Mal" McGregor (1892-1945) was a film actor. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malcolm_McGregor Here's her grave marker in Glendale (along with a photo of her as an adult): www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=77377805

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Little Miss Aimee Rochester was the only bridal attendant at the wedding of Miss Louise Gardner, daughter of Mrs. C. F. Gardner, and Frederick Rodgers, son of the late Rear Admiral Frederick Rodgers, U.S.N., on December 29, 1917. There were no ushers and no reception. The wedding was a quiet one due to mourning. –The New York Times
